ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Selo's Song of Travel
ygData.msgSnippet: Agreed, which is why I give him props in this case.  Still if I had his job, and thank goodness I do not, I would make sure I learned a lot about every class.
ygData.messageBody:
Agreed, which is why I give him props in this case. Still if I had his job,
and thank goodness I do not, I would make sure I learned a lot about every
class. I have noticed he has had some better ideas lately. I still think
removing the invis component is the right move. It would make the song more
useful overall while reducing its uses in some specialty situations. There
is precious little you cannot outrun with SSoT and levitation alone.

Kit

Guys,

He's a necro, he had an idea then got corrected on it. Quit bashing for no
damn reason. Gordon has never played a bard, and likely never will.

FYI: I've known him, in game, since Beta 2. He's a nice guy, fun to hunt
with and very knowledgeable about his OWN class. Just like we are. You
can't blame him for not knowing bards. He's a mouthpiece, nothing more. He
had an idea, offered it up and was wrong and admitted it.

What MORE do you want?

I'll jump on him anytime he's blatantly wrong but when he admits his mistake
give him a break

Lyrnia
